samples.context: I have an important business trip today that requires a connecting flight. If my initial flight is on time, I'll make my connecting flight smoothly. However, if traffic is bad on the way to the airport, I will miss my flight altogether. It seems either my flight will be on time, traffic will be bad, or perhaps both.
samples.question: If I did not miss my flight, then did I make my connecting flight?

samples.context: I'm planning a weekend getaway but am unsure how I'll get there. If my car has enough gas, I'll drive to the mountains. Also, if the train tickets are affordable, I'll take the train to the beach instead. It seems either I have enough gas, or cheap train tickets, or possibly both.
samples.question: If I did not take the train to the beach, then did I drive to the mountains?

samples.context: I have some plans for my day off today. If the package with my new bookshelf arrives today, I'll start building it. But if my friend asks me to help them move, I'll spend the day helping them instead. It seems either my package will arrive, or my friend will need help, or perhaps both will happen.
samples.question: If I didn't spend the day helping my friend, then did I start building my new bookshelf?

samples.context: Making weekend plans can be tricky with different options. If I'm invited to a friend's fun party, I'll probably go. But if my parents visit from out of town, I'll take them sightseeing instead. It seems either I'm invited to the party, or my parents will visit, or perhaps both will happen.
samples.question: If I did not take my parents sightseeing, then did I go to the party?

samples.context: Making evening plans can sometimes be tricky. If my friend invites me over for dinner, I will go to their house for dinner. However, if I promised my family I would cook dinner tonight, I will need to stay home and cook dinner instead. It appears either I'll be invited out, or I'll need to cook at home, or perhaps both.
samples.question: If I did not stay home and cook dinner, then did I go to my friend's house for dinner?

samples.context: I'm not sure what I'll end up doing today. If my package arrives, I can finally wrap my friend's gift for her birthday. But if the store has a sale, I may shop for some new clothes. It seems either my package will come, there will be a sale, or perhaps both will happen.
samples.question: If I did not shop for new clothes, then did I wrap my friend's gift?

samples.context: As Friday arrived, I was looking forward to relaxing on the weekend. If it is the weekend, I will sleep in late and take it easy. However, if I have a big project due Monday, I will need to work all weekend on it. It's looking like either it will be the weekend, or I'll have a project due, perhaps both.
samples.question: If I did not work all weekend on the project, then did I sleep in late?

samples.context: I was excited to hear my favorite band was coming to town. If my favorite band is playing a concert nearby, I will buy tickets to the show. However, if I have a big deadline at work, I will have to work late and miss the concert. It seems either the concert will happen, or I'll have a deadline, or maybe both.
samples.question: If I did not have to work late and miss the concert, then did I buy tickets to the show?

samples.context: I have some plans coming up this weekend that I'm excited about. If my favorite band is playing a concert in town, I'll buy tickets to go see them. Also, if I have a big exam coming up, I'll need to stay home and study instead of going out. It looks like either the concert will happen, or I'll have that exam, or perhaps both.
samples.question: If I didn't stay home and study, then did I buy concert tickets?

samples.context: To be productive tomorrow, I need rest tonight. If I get a good night's sleep, I'll have energy in the morning. However, if the neighbors are noisy at night, I'll probably toss and turn. It seems either I'll sleep well or there will be noise, maybe both.
samples.question: If I did not toss and turn, then did I have energy in the morning?

samples.context: With everything stored digitally these days, computer security is so important. If my computer has antivirus software, my files will be secure. Also, if there is a malware attack, my computer could crash. It seems either I have antivirus, there will be an attack, or possibly both.
samples.question: If my computer did not crash, then were my files secure?

samples.context: After school, my son and I have some free time this afternoon. If he finishes his homework early, we can play catch outside. But if it starts raining, we'll watch a movie inside instead. It looks like either he'll finish homework early, it will rain, or maybe both.
samples.question: If we did not watch a movie inside, then did we play catch outside?

samples.context: Traveling today has me a bit concerned. If my initial flight gets delayed, I'll miss my connecting flight. Also, if traffic is bad on the way to the airport, that could make me miss my flight too. It seems either my first flight will be delayed, or there will be traffic, or maybe both will happen.
samples.question: If I didn't miss my flight, then did I miss my connecting flight?

samples.context: With my roommate gone, I considered my options for the weekend. If my roommate is out of town, I will throw a party at our apartment. However, if I have a big exam on Monday, I will need to stay in and study all weekend instead. It looks like either my roommate will be gone, or I'll have an exam coming up, or perhaps both.
samples.question: If I did not stay in and study all weekend, then did I throw a party at our apartment?

samples.context: I have a big exam coming up that I'm trying to prepare for. If I study hard, I'll ace the test. Also, if the test is postponed, I'll get more time to prepare. It looks like either I'll study hard, the test is postponed, or maybe both will happen.
samples.question: If I did not get more time to prepare, then did I ace the test?
